report_title: Breakfast Restaurants & Diners in the US
executive_summary: Breakfast restaurants and diners experienced greater volatility in the last few years because of domestic and global economic changes. Prior to the outbreak of COVID-19 and its subsequent economic impact, breakfast restaurants were bolstered by growth in revenue. When the pandemic hit, restaurant owners were forced to curtail dine-in operations, contributing to a massive dip in revenue growth in 2020. Recovery was swift, however, once the government lifted stay-at-home orders, leaving consumers eager to eat out again. Rising consumer spending throughout the last few years has been a driver behind a rise in consumer expenditures on dining out. Demand for breakfast restaurants and diners has grown, with the impact of the pandemic on revenue growth being relatively brief. Revenue grew at a CAGR of 1.7% to $14.6 billion over the last five years, including a rise of 1.8% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumer Trends in Spending and Travel are Volatile
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Business at breakfast restaurants and diners is driven by consumer trends in spending and travel. Consumer spending has risen over the last few years, leading to a higher propensity for consumers to purchase food away from home and benefiting breakfast restaurant owners. When consumers travel, for work or for leisure, breakfast gives them the energy to get through their day. Without access to kitchens or time to prepare meals, travelers stop by breakfast restaurants to meet this need or as a chance to explore local eateries. Domestic travel experienced a sharp decline following the outbreak of COVID-19, hurting demand from hungry consumers during the pandemic. Travel has since rebounded as travel restrictions have been lifted.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE OUTBREAK OF COVID-19 STALLED REVENUE GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the pandemic, consumer spending declined amid an economic downturn. To cope with associated financial stress, consumers restricted discretionary spending and opted to prepare meals at home rather than eat out for breakfast. Domestic travel sharply declined during the pandemic as social distancing regulations, temporary shutdowns and limited operations in restaurants contributed to a major dip in revenue in 2020. Customer concerns about virus transmission led to some changes to combat safety concerns, like growth in takeout offerings, increased cleaning procedures and reduced dining capacity. This rise in purchases had the potential to hinder profitability, but falling wage costs helped boost profit over the last five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: SUPPLY CHAIN DISRUPTIONS CONTRIBUTED TO INGREDIENT SHORTAGES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Breakfast restaurants and diners faced challenges securing essential ingredients like eggs, bacon and specialty items thanks to supply chain disruptions during the pandemic. Fluctuating availability led to menu inconsistencies, forcing eateries to adapt their offerings based on ingredient availability, impacting customer choices. Cost fluctuations as a result of disrupted supply chains affected profit for restaurants, leading them to implement price adjustments for breakfast items, influencing consumer spending habits. To cope with rising purchase costs and falling demand, restaurant owners in this industry laid off many employees.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RESTAURANTS WILL CAPITALIZE ON CONSUMERS' GROWING INTEREST IN HOLISTIC WELL-BEING
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Breakfast restaurants and diners will exhibit a strong recovery, swiftly exceeding pre-pandemic revenue. Recovery is impacted by growth in the healthy eating index, which is indicative of demand for healthy foods and ensuring a balanced diet. Many breakfast staples like fruit and eggs are considered nutritional options, making breakfast restaurants a place where people can easily watch what they eat. Increased attention on diverse dietary preferences like vegan, keto, paleo or gluten-free diets will drive eateries to expand their breakfast menus to accommodate various dietary needs and restrictions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SUSTAINABILITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSCIOUSNESS WILL RESHAPE RESTAURANTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A growth in plant-based breakfast offerings is anticipated to meet the rising demand for environmentally friendly and healthier choices. These include plant-based meats, dairy alternatives and innovative plant-centric dishes. Restaurants will focus on minimizing food waste by introducing initiatives like smaller portion sizes, composting, or partnerships with food rescue organizations, aligning with sustainability goals. Consumers' emphasis on ethical sourcing will prompt breakfast spots to highlight transparency in ingredient sourcing, showcasing local or sustainable produce and fostering trust with patrons. By boldly demonstrating environmental consciousness, breakfast restaurants and diners align themselves with consumer values and differentiate themselves from their competition.

industry_definition: The industry includes chain and franchised restaurants that provide breakfast-style food to patrons. Customers order and are served by waiters.

key_trends: Demand for eating out at breakfast restaurants and diners is influenced by the level of consumer spending. Since dining out is a nonessential cost for most individuals, disruptions to the economy, like those brought on by COVID-19, can have a major impact on revenue.

Breakfast restaurant and diner owners saw a hike in revenue and profit over the last five years. Despite contracting in 2020 during the pandemic, a quick recovery was observed thanks to increased spending in 2021.

Health and safety regulations, including food handling, hygiene standards and sanitation protocols, significantly impact breakfast restaurants and diners. Labor laws governing wages, working hours and employee safety also play a crucial role in operations.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers younger than 35, encompassing millennials and Gen Z, prioritize convenience, experience and health in their purchasing decisions. This demographic prefers fast, convenient breakfast options without compromising quality.

Consumers aged 35 to 54 are typically established in their careers, with families or significant responsibilities. They prioritize convenience, quality and value in their dining choices, seeking options that cater to their busy lifestyles and varied tastes.
Consumers aged 55 and older value tradition, comfort and reliability in their dining experiences. They prioritize familiarity and consistency.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Pancakes, Pastries, Toast and Similar Items
products_and_services.product_description: Pancakes, pastries, toast and similar items form the cornerstone of breakfast menus, appealing to diverse tastes and preferences.
Bacon, sausage, and other meats constitute staple protein options in breakfast menus, serving as both signature dishes or key ingredients in various breakfast items.
Eggs are a staple in breakfast dishes, serving as a versatile ingredient in various morning classics like omelets, scrambled eggs and various baked goods.
Sweet goods include the array of cookies, muffins, danishes, cinnamon rolls and other delectable treats that are sold at these establishments.
Beverages at breakfast restaurants and diners include coffee, tea, juices, smoothies and specialty drinks.

basis_points.basis_title: High start-up costs and intense competition
basis_points.basis_description: High start-up costs and intense competition can be significant barriers for entry for a new breakfast restaurant.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Added regulations also forced many restaurants to temporarily close and increase takeout operations, requiring additional packaging containers. Restaurants implemented other safety protocols, including limited-capacity indoor dining, building structures for outdoor dining in colder months and adding additional cleaning measures.
Inflation and supply chain issues also lead to the rise in the cost of basic ingredients and operational expenses for breakfast restaurants, leading to higher purchase costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE PANDEMIC CREATED SUPPLY CHAIN DISRUPTIONS
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fluctuating costs due to supply chain disruptions affect profit, forcing adjustments in pricing.

volatility_points.volatility_title: UNEMPLOYMENT LEVELS ROSE DURING THE PANDEMIC
volatility_points.volatility_description: Labor shortages across many industries have caused restaurateurs difficulty in hiring and retaining staff, resulting in inconsistent service quality.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: EGGS AND BREAKFAST MEALS ARE A NUTRITIOUS AND POPULAR CHOICE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Eggs are a staple in breakfast dishes, serving as a versatile ingredient in various morning classics like omelets, scrambled eggs and various baked goods. Increased focus on health-conscious eating habits has elevated the demand for protein-rich breakfast options, and eggs are a nutritious choice. This surge in health consciousness drives consumers towards breakfast items featuring eggs, benefiting restaurants offering healthier morning options.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Bacon, Sausage and Other Meats are Protein-Rich
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Bacon, sausage, and other meats constitute staple protein options in breakfast menus, serving as both signature dishes or key ingredients in various breakfast items.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Pancakes, Pastries, Toast and Similar Items are Quintessential Morning Fare
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Pancakes, pastries, toast and similar items form the cornerstone of breakfast menus, appealing to diverse tastes and preferences. Amid health-conscious trends, consumers seek healthier alternatives, impacting demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Sweet Goods Have Declined in Demand with Rising Health Concerns
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Sweet goods include the array of cookies, muffins, danishes, cinnamon rolls and other delectable treats that are sold at these establishments. Shifting consumer preferences have introduced an emphasis on low-sugar, whole-grain or gluten-free alternatives.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Beverages and Other Products Declined in Demand as Health-Consciousness Rises
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Beverages at breakfast restaurants and diners include coffee, tea, juices, smoothies and specialty drinks. Consumers seeking to make healthier choices are now presented options like plant-based milks, and lower or sugar-free drinks.

FAQs.answer: The pandemic created supply chain disruptions that affected the availability of key ingredients like eggs, bacon, or specialty items, which impacted menu offerings at breakfast restaurants.
